      void draw(int playTimer) 
      void drawMap()
      draws the part of the map which is currently focussed by the camera on the screen
      void drawMap(int offsetX, int offsetY)
      draws the part of the map which is currently focussed by the camera on the screen.
      You need to draw something over the offset, to prevent the edge of the map to be displayed below it
      Has to be called before Camera.translateGraphics() !
      float getCameraX() 
      float getCameraY() 
      void setPerson(Person person) 
      void translateGraphics()
      Translates the Graphics-context to the coordinates of the map - now everything can be drawn with it's NATURAL coordinates.
      void untranslateGraphics()
      Reverses the Graphics-translation of Camera.translatesGraphics().

    • Constructor Detail

      • Camera

        public Camera(org.newdawn.slick.tiled.TiledMap map,
      Person person)
        Create a new camera
        Parameters:
        gc - the GameContainer, used for getting the size of the GameCanvas
        map - the TiledMap used for the current scene

    • Method Detail

      • centerOn

        public void centerOn(float x,
            float y)
        "locks" the camera on the given coordinates. The camera tries to keep the location in it's center.
        Parameters:
        x - the real x-coordinate (in pixel) which should be centered on the screen
        y - the real y-coordinate (in pixel) which should be centered on the screen

      • centerOn

        public void centerOn(float x,
            float y,
            float height,
            float width)
        "locks" the camera on the center of the given Rectangle. The camera tries to keep the location in it's center.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate (in pixel) of the top-left corner of the rectangle
        y - the y-coordinate (in pixel) of the top-left corner of the rectangle
        height - the height (in pixel) of the rectangle
        width - the width (in pixel) of the rectangle

      • centerOn

        public void centerOn(org.newdawn.slick.geom.Shape shape)
        "locks the camera on the center of the given Shape. The camera tries to keep the location in it's center.
        Parameters:
        shape - the Shape which should be centered on the screen

      • drawMap

        public void drawMap()
        draws the part of the map which is currently focussed by the camera on the screen

      • draw

        public void draw(int playTimer)

      • drawMap

        public void drawMap(int offsetX,
           int offsetY)
        draws the part of the map which is currently focussed by the camera on the screen.
        You need to draw something over the offset, to prevent the edge of the map to be displayed below it
        Has to be called before Camera.translateGraphics() !
        Parameters:
        offsetX - the x-coordinate (in pixel) where the camera should start drawing the map at
        offsetY - the y-coordinate (in pixel) where the camera should start drawing the map at

      • translateGraphics

        public void translateGraphics()
        Translates the Graphics-context to the coordinates of the map - now everything can be drawn with it's NATURAL coordinates.

      • untranslateGraphics

        public void untranslateGraphics()
        Reverses the Graphics-translation of Camera.translatesGraphics(). Call this before drawing HUD-elements or the like

      • setPerson

        public void setPerson(Person person)

      • getCameraX

        public float getCameraX()

      • getCameraY

        public float getCameraY()
